    • Method Detail

      • setSound

        public void setSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Set the sound to play when the screen is displayed
        Parameters:
        soundName - Name of the sound file to play

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Indicate that this scene should not be displayed

      • addTapControl

        public SceneActor addTapControl(float x,
                                float y,
                                float width,
                                float height,
                                java.lang.String imgName,
                                TouchEventHandler action)
        Add a button that pauses the game (via a single tap) by causing a PauseScene to be displayed. Note that you must configure a PauseScene, or pressing this button will cause your game to crash.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button

      • suppressClearClick

        public void suppressClearClick()
        Indicate that tapping the non-button parts of the scene shouldn't return immediately to the game.

      • setExpire

        public void setExpire(float duration)
        The default is for a PreScene to show until the user touches it to dismiss it. To have the PreScene disappear after a fixed time instead, use this.
        Parameters:
        duration - The time, in seconds, before the PreScene should disappear.

      • setDefaultText

        public void setDefaultText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the text that should be drawn, centered, when the level is lost
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display. Use "" to disable

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset a scene, so we can change what is on it. Only useful for the scenes we show when pausing the game.

      • show

        public abstract void show()
        This is the code to start showing a scene

      • dismiss

        public abstract void dismiss()
        This is the code to remove a scene. It is specific to they type of scene being displayed

      • makePicture

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable makePicture(float x,
                                                 float y,
                                                 float width,
                                                 float height,
                                                 java.lang.String imgName,
                                                 int zIndex)
        Create a Renderable that consists of an image
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner, in pixels
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner, in pixels
        width - The image width, in pixels
        height - The image height, in pixels
        imgName - The file name for the image, or ""
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the image
